jobs.description:
This team enables automation at Amazon Robotics Fulfillment centers. This team serves Amazon Internal Fulfillment Technologies & Robotics teams by enabling automation, which includes real-time & offline (image/video) data auditing services. One of the key contributions of this team is supporting the fulfillment centers in maintaining inventory accuracy.

An Associate in this role is required to watch the video of the stowing action at a fulfillment center, understand it thoroughly and make best use of human judgement in combination with the tools and resources to indicate the activity captured in the video. They are expected to verify or mark the location of product through a tool while maintaining highest level of accuracy. This process helps in maintaining the fulfillment center's stow quality. This is an operational role. Under general supervision, the Associate performs precise and thorough video/image audits with high degree of accuracy and speed, thus aiding defect reduction.


Key job responsibilities
The Associate has to watch several hundred videos in a shift and provide responses by following goals on accuracy (quality), speed (productivity) and right / acceptable practices. Associates are required to take breaks at the pre-defined slots and ensure 6.8 to 7 hours’ time per day is spent to answer the videos. Associates who are hired to work from home should maintain (1) dedicated workspace i.e., table, chair & sufficient lighting (2) workspace / work related data shouldn’t be accessed by anyone other than employee

The candidate is expected to demonstrate:
• Willingness to work in Non-tech role for contract duration of 6 months
• Ability to audit image/video/text based Jobs
• Ability to identify details from blurry, less sharp videos and provide correct response. Requires high level of attention & focus on screen
• Willingness to work on incremental targets/goals on quality & productivity
• Fast Pace of implementation & consistent performance
• Ability to work in rotational shifts (including night shifts), remote teams and exceptionally good team player
• Readiness to come to office for few days (when required, applicable for associates working from home)
• Willing to switch ON laptop camera while on virtual meetings.

A day in the life
Associates work in 24x7 environment with rotational shifts. Associates would be working in a 9 hour shift, including pre-scheduled breaks. The shift timings would be subject to change every 3-4 months or as per business requirement. In case associate is working in night shift, night shift allowance will be provided as per applicable Amazon’s work policy.

Weekly Offs: Rotational two-consecutive day off (it is a 5-day working week with 2 consecutive days off, not necessarily Saturday and Sunday) or as per business discretion.


About the team
Data Auditing Operations team provides human support to Amazon Fulfillment facilities with goal of enabling hands-free active stowing through visual audits on videos/images. Videos with brief duration (typically between 15 and 20seconds) are sent to Operations Team for humans to audit them with information on products being stored at fulfilment centers. For business use, these videos must be thoroughly reviewed and audited using best human judgement. The effectiveness of automated process will be increased by using videos that Associates have audited. This process helps maintaining stow quality at fulfillment center and Associate will be further evaluated for performance improvements/coaching.
jobs.description_short: This team enables automation at Amazon Robotics Fulfillment centers. This team serves Amazon Internal Fulfillment Technologies & Robotics teams by enabling automation, which includes real-time & offline

jobs.title: Associate, ML Data Operations, GO-AI Operations

jobs.basic_qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in any field of study
jobs.description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:-
• Ensure HC delivery to business through effective planning, absenteeism assumption and studying external impact like weather, festival etc.
• Lead employee connect and engagement: Engage with employees to ensure higher morale and productivity, handle grievance, employee query etc.
• Proactive sensing of ER issues and timely escalation to leadership as required
• Proficient in data analysis, report & dashboard preparation through effective usage of HRIS and MS excel office
• Stake holder Management : Critical part of this role is stake holder management including and not limited to Operations Leaders, manpower agency, transportation and canteen vendors etc.

Basic qualification and skill:
• Effective communication and negotiation skills.
• Knowledge of ER, compliance will be added advantage
• Demonstrated high level of integrity, intellectual honesty, and work ethic.
• Consistent effort, commitment and willingness to go above and beyond when needed.
• Effective team player, acts like an owner, and ultimately focused on delivering results with high standards
jobs.description_short: JOB DESCRIPTION:-• Ensure HC delivery to business through effective planning, absenteeism assumption and studying external impact like weather, festival etc.• Lead employee connect and engagement: Engage

- MBA, or Master's degree

• Fast Pace of implementation & consistent performance

One of the key contributions of this team is supporting the fulfillment centers in maintaining inventory accuracy.

An Associate in this role is required to watch the video of the stowing action at a fulfillment center, understand it thoroughly and make best use of human judgement in combination with the tools and resources to indicate the activity captured in the video. They are expected to verify or mark the location of product through a tool while maintaining highest level of accuracy. This process helps in maintaining the fulfillment center's stow quality. This is an operational role. Under general supervision, the Associate performs precise and thorough video/image audits with high degree of accuracy and speed, thus aiding defect reduction.


Key job responsibilities
The Associate has to watch several hundred videos in a shift and provide responses by following goals on accuracy (quality), speed (productivity) and right / acceptable practices. Associates are required to take breaks at the pre-defined slots and ensure 6.8 to 7 hours’ time per day is spent to answer the videos. Associates who are hired to work from home should maintain (1) dedicated workspace i.e., table, chair & sufficient lighting (2) workspace / work related data shouldn’t be accessed by anyone other than employee

The candidate is expected to demonstrate:
• Willingness to work in Non-tech role for contract duration of 6 months
• Ability to audit image/video/text based Jobs
• Ability to identify details from blurry, less sharp videos and provide correct response. Requires high level of attention & focus on screen
• Willingness to work on incremental targets/goals on quality & productivity
• Fast Pace of implementation & consistent performance
• Ability to work in rotational shifts (including night shifts), remote teams and exceptionally good team player
• Readiness to come to office for few days (when required, applicable for associates working from home)
• Willing to switch ON laptop camera while on virtual meetings.

A day in the life
Associates work in 24x7 environment with rotational shifts. Associates would be working in a 9 hour shift, including pre-scheduled breaks. The shift timings would be subject to change every 3-4 months or as per business requirement. In case associate is working in night shift, night shift allowance will be provided as per applicable Amazon’s work policy.

Weekly Offs: Rotational two-consecutive day off (it is a 5-day working week with 2 consecutive days off, not necessarily Saturday and Sunday) or as per business discretion.


About the team
Data Auditing Operations team provides human support to Amazon Fulfillment facilities with goal of enabling hands-free active stowing through visual audits on videos/images. Videos with brief duration (typically between 15 and 20seconds) are sent to Operations Team for humans to audit them with information on products being stored at fulfilment centers. For business use, these videos must be thoroughly reviewed and audited using best human judgement. The effectiveness of automated process will be increased by using videos that Associates have audited. This process helps maintaining stow quality at fulfillment center and Associate will be further evaluated for performance improvements/coaching.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 5+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent
- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
- Experience with end to end product delivery
- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
- Experience as a product manager or owner
- Experience owning technology products
jobs.description:
We're seeking an entrepreneurial Product Manager to own and drive our cross-border commerce products, focusing on expanding our Global Store presence and exports program while optimizing business performance and customer experience across regions.

Key Responsibilities:

Product Strategy & Execution:
• Own the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for cross-border commerce initiatives
• Drive product development from conception to launch, including Global Store expansion and exports
• Define and prioritize product requirements through data-driven decision making
• Lead agile development processes with engineering and design teams

Business & Financial Management:
• Develop business cases and financial models for new market opportunities
• Own P&L metrics for cross-border products and initiatives
• Drive revenue growth and profitability through product optimization
• Create and monitor key business metrics and financial performance indicators

E-commerce & Customer Experience:
• Design and optimize end-to-end customer journeys for international shoppers
• Lead localization efforts including payment methods, pricing strategies, and user interfaces
• Analyze customer behavior data to identify opportunities and optimize conversion
• Partner with UX teams to create seamless shopping experiences

Cross-functional Leadership:
• Work with Tech, Business, Finance, Operations, and regional teams
• Collaborate with logistics partners on international shipping solutions
• Ensure compliance with regional regulations while maintaining product vision

Analytics & Data-Driven Decision Making:
• Leverage data analytics to drive product decisions and prioritization
• Conduct market analysis and competitive research
• Design and analyze A/B tests to optimize product performance
• Create and monitor dashboards for key metrics

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with marketplace or retail platforms
• Strong understanding of international payment systems and financial regulations
• Background in growth product management
• Experience with machine learning and automation initiatives
• Proficiency in multiple languages

Technical Skills:
• SQL and data analysis tools (e.g., Python, R)
• Business intelligence platforms (e.g., Tableau, Looker)
• Product analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Mixpanel)
• Financial modeling and analysis
• A/B testing frameworks
